snippet: Stephanie A. Miner said her remarks that the governor had not done enough to help municipalities were made to ensure that the concerns of her constituents were being heard.
abstract: Syracuse Mayor Stephanie A Miner has gone from a simple position of power in New York State's Democratic ranks to a more complex role of equal parts hometown hero and the defacto leader of a wider movement to advocate for suffering New York cities, both upstate and elsewhere; Miner published a New York Times Op-Ed in February that criticized Gov Andrew M Cuomo for proposal to let cities defer some pension costs.
lead_paragraph: Stephanie A. Miner said her remarks that the governor had not done enough to help municipalities were made to ensure that the concerns of her constituents were being heard.

headline.seo: For Syracuse Mayor Stephanie A. Miner, Criticism of Cuomo Raises Profile
headline.main: Criticism of Cuomo Over Plight of Cities Raises Syracuse Mayor’s Profile
headline.print_headline: Criticism of Cuomo Over Plight of Cities Raises Syracuse Mayor’s Profile
